channel.title: MIT Combat Robotics Club
channel.description: {"meta"=>"MIT Combat Robotics Club is dedicated to fighting robots and destruction.", "subtitle"=>"A club dedicated to destruction"}

item.title: Wedgelets and Drums
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"MIT Combat Robotics Club", "email"=>"mit-crc-exec@mit.edu", "info"=>nil}
item.description: This weekend was a lot of fabrication - we are finishing up the first iteration of the drive pods and also trying out other pieces of armor.

item.title: Prius Motors and too much Power
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"MIT Combat Robotics Club", "email"=>"mit-crc-exec@mit.edu", "info"=>nil}
item.description: When we first starting building the robot, Bayley was intent on using the Prius motor to power our drum. With 80kW of power and a max speed of 8000rpm, it makes for a powerful drum limited only by air resistance and the fact that we want to throw our opponent, not mill them. The Prius motor would be hooked up through a reverser to the weapon, which would spin at 16,000 rpm.

item.title: CAD updates
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"MIT Combat Robotics Club", "email"=>"mit-crc-exec@mit.edu", "info"=>nil}
item.description: Like all children, the Dentist has had a lot of growing pains. In the design, we’ve done an overhaul of the internal frame. In the first iteration of the drive pods, we noticed that excessive amounts of precision machining was slowing us down in progress. In the interest of time, we’ve switched over to a welded tube frame for the internals while still preserving the external structure.

item.title: Announcing the Dentist
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"MIT Combat Robotics Club", "email"=>"mit-crc-exec@mit.edu", "info"=>nil}
item.description: This is the moment of birth onto the world stage for our robot, the Dentist. This website will be used for documenting the creation of our robot, the Dentist!
